definition: Inexpensive; reasonably priced.
pro: The housing in this area is surprisingly affordable.
insight: CEFR A2: Use this to sound more professional than just saying 'cheap'.

definition: To travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis.
basic: I go to work by bus.
pro: My daily commute takes about forty minutes by train.
insight: CEFR B1: This is the standard global term for work/study travel.

definition: Fitting in well with a person's needs or plans.
basic: This time is good for me.
pro: Is the 4 PM slot convenient for our meeting?
insight: CEFR A2: Essential for making plans and scheduling.

definition: A collection of things lying about in an untidy mass.
pro: I need to clear the clutter off my desk before I start working.
insight: CEFR B1: Used to describe physical or digital mess.

definition: Full of incessant or frantic activity.
pro: It has been an incredibly hectic week so far.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this when 'busy' isn't strong enough.

definition: A thing that motivates or encourages one to do something.
pro: The company offers a performance bonus as an incentive.
insight: CEFR B2: High-frequency term for motivation.

definition: Plan and direct the course of a journey.
pro: It is difficult to navigate the narrow streets of the old city.
insight: CEFR B1: Used for maps, websites, and physical travel.

definition: No longer produced or used; out of date.
pro: Manual typewriters have become largely obsolete.
insight: CEFR B2: Perfect for describing old technology or rules.

definition: Make the best or most effective use of a situation or resource.
pro: We need to optimize the app to save battery life.
insight: CEFR B2: A very common 'Natural' English term for improvement.

definition: Determine the order for dealing with a series of items or tasks according to their importance.
pro: You need to prioritize your tasks to meet the deadline.
insight: CEFR B1: Essential for time management discussions.

definition: Delay or postpone action; put off doing something.
pro: I tend to procrastinate when faced with a difficult task.
insight: CEFR B2: A classic term for daily habits.

definition: Consistently good in quality or performance; able to be trusted.
pro: We need a reliable car for the long road trip.
insight: CEFR B1: Used for people, machines, and information.

definition: Unable to bend or be forced out of shape; not flexible.
pro: The school has a rigid policy regarding attendance.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this to describe strict rules or people.

definition: Performed or occurring as a result of a sudden inner impulse.
pro: We took a spontaneous trip to the beach last Sunday.
insight: CEFR B1: Describes fun, unplanned actions.

definition: Requiring or using great exertion.
pro: The doctor advised me to avoid strenuous exercise for a week.
insight: CEFR B2: Used for physical or mental effort.

definition: A person or thing acting or serving in place of another.
pro: You can substitute honey for sugar in this recipe.
insight: CEFR B1: Essential for cooking, work, and sports.

definition: Enough; adequate.
pro: Do we have sufficient evidence to support this claim?
insight: CEFR B1: More formal and precise than 'enough'.

definition: Too long, slow, or dull; tiresome or monotonous.
pro: Checking the data line by line was a tedious process.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this for boring, repetitive work.

definition: Of uncertain, indefinite, or unclear character or meaning.
pro: The instructions were too vague for me to follow.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this when someone isn't giving enough detail.

definition: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
pro: This jacket is versatile enough to wear in any season.
insight: CEFR B2: Describes a person or an object with many skills/uses.

definition: Accept or admit the existence or truth of.
pro: Please acknowledge receipt of this email.
insight: CEFR B1: Very common in professional social interaction.

definition: Open to more than one interpretation; not having one obvious meaning.
pro: His response to my question was quite ambiguous.
insight: CEFR C1: High-level word for unclear intentions.

definition: Having or showing the ability to speak fluently and coherently.
pro: She is very articulate and expresses her ideas well.
insight: CEFR B2: A major compliment for a good speaker.

definition: Of undisputed origin and not a copy; genuine.
pro: We visited an authentic Italian restaurant last night.
insight: CEFR B1: Used for food, people, and experiences.

definition: A general agreement.
pro: We finally reached a consensus on where to go for dinner.
insight: CEFR B2: Used in group discussions and meetings.

definition: Deny the truth of (a statement) by asserting the opposite.
pro: I don't want to contradict you, but I saw it differently.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this to disagree politely.

definition: Having or showing an ability to deal with people in a sensitive and effective way.
pro: He gave a very diplomatic answer to the difficult question.
insight: CEFR B2: Essential for conflict resolution.

definition: Involving many carefully arranged parts or details; detailed and complicated.
pro: Could you please elaborate on your previous point?
insight: CEFR B2: The best way to ask for more information.

definition: The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
pro: It is important to show empathy when a friend is struggling.
insight: CEFR B2: A key social-emotional word.

definition: Used to add a further remark or a random piece of information.
pro: Incidentally, I'll be in your neighborhood tomorrow.
insight: CEFR B2: A perfect transition word for conversation.

definition: Having or showing an accurate and deep intuitive understanding.
pro: That was an insightful comment about the movie.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this to praise someone's thoughts.

definition: With mutual action; in a manner relative to each of two or more parties.
pro: We reached a mutually beneficial agreement.
insight: CEFR B2: High-level word for shared interests.

definition: A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
pro: From my perspective, the plan seems solid.
insight: CEFR B1: Standard term for sharing viewpoints.

definition: Of an argument or statement seeming reasonable or probable.
pro: That sounds like a plausible explanation for the delay.
insight: CEFR B2: Used to discuss possibilities.

definition: Given, felt, or done in return.
pro: Friendship should always be a reciprocal relationship.
insight: CEFR C1: Describes balanced relationships.

definition: Able to be related to; enabling a person to feel that they can understand.
pro: The main character's struggle was so relatable.
insight: CEFR B1: Extremely common in modern slang and social media.

definition: Not easily convinced; having doubts or reservations.
pro: I'm a bit skeptical about his ability to finish on time.
insight: CEFR B2: A polite way to express doubt.

definition: Form a theory or conjecture about a subject without firm evidence.
pro: I don't want to speculate on why she left early.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this when you are just guessing.

definition: Of little value or importance.
pro: Let's not waste time arguing over trivial matters.
insight: CEFR B2: Perfect for dismissing small problems.

definition: Of two or more people fully in agreement.
pro: The decision to hire him was unanimous.
insight: CEFR C1: Use when agreement is 100%.

definition: Greatly dismayed or horrified.
pro: I was appalled by the way they treated the animals.
insight: CEFR C1: A strong word for negative shock.

definition: Anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen.
pro: I'm a bit apprehensive about my first day at college.
insight: CEFR B2: A professional way to say you are nervous.

definition: Perplexed and confused; very puzzled.
pro: I was bewildered by the complex instructions.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this when something is totally unclear.

definition: In a state of peaceful happiness.
pro: I am perfectly content staying home with a good book.
insight: CEFR B1: Better than 'happy' for a calm feeling.

definition: Severe and overwhelming shock or grief.
pro: He was devastated when he heard the bad news.
insight: CEFR B2: Use for very strong emotional pain.

definition: Feeling or expressing overwhelming happiness or joyful excitement.
pro: She was ecstatic when she got the job offer.
insight: CEFR B2: Use for peak excitement.

definition: Intensely irritated and frustrated.
pro: The teacher gave an exasperated sigh at the noisy class.
insight: CEFR B2: Use when your patience is gone.

definition: Having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.
pro: He seemed indifferent to the outcome of the match.
insight: CEFR B2: Describes a lack of interest.

definition: Frightened or overawed, especially in order to make them do what one wants.
pro: I felt a bit intimidated by the large crowd.
insight: CEFR B2: Describes feeling less confident around others.

definition: Showing or feeling slight anger; annoyed.
pro: I was irritated by the constant noise outside.
insight: CEFR B1: A standard word for mild annoyance.

definition: A feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause.
pro: The rainy weather made me feel quite melancholy.
insight: CEFR C1: A poetic way to describe sadness.

definition: A sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past.
pro: Old photos always make me feel nostalgic.
insight: CEFR B1: Very common when talking about childhood.

definition: Hopeful and confident about the future.
pro: I am optimistic that we will finish on time.
insight: CEFR B1: A key personality trait word.

definition: Having a strong emotional effect; feeling like there is too much to handle.
pro: I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed with my current workload.
insight: CEFR B2: Essential for mental health discussions.

definition: Tending to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.
pro: Don't be so pessimistic; I'm sure it will work out.
insight: CEFR B1: The opposite of optimistic.

definition: Feeling relaxed because something difficult has stopped.
pro: I was so relieved to hear that you are safe.
insight: CEFR A2: Essential for after-stress situations.

definition: Unwilling and hesitant; disinclined.
pro: He was reluctant to share his secret with me.
insight: CEFR B2: High-level word for hesitation.

definition: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
pro: She is very resilient and never gives up.
insight: CEFR C1: A very positive personality description.

definition: Extremely pleased and excited.
pro: I'm thrilled to be invited to your party!
insight: CEFR B1: Better than 'happy' for excitement.

definition: Susceptible to physical or emotional attack or harm.
pro: It's okay to feel vulnerable and ask for help.
insight: CEFR C1: An important word for emotional honesty.

definition: As another option or possibility.
pro: We could take the train; alternatively, we could drive.
insight: CEFR B1: Perfect for offering choices.

definition: As a result.
pro: The flight was canceled; consequently, I missed the wedding.
insight: CEFR B2: A professional way to show results.

definition: Introducing a statement that reverses one that has just been made.
pro: He is very shy; conversely, his sister is very outgoing.
insight: CEFR C1: Used for strong comparisons.

definition: Without being affected by; in spite of.
pro: We went for a walk despite the heavy rain.
insight: CEFR B1: Essential for showing contrast.

definition: Used to emphasize the most basic or fundamental nature of something.
pro: Essentially, we just need to fix the main bug.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this to simplify an idea.

definition: To the exclusion of others; only.
pro: This area is exclusively for club members.
insight: CEFR B2: Used for limits and permissions.

definition: Forming a necessary base or core; of central importance.
pro: Reading is a fundamental skill for all students.
insight: CEFR B2: High-level word for 'basic'.

definition: In addition; besides (used to introduce a fresh consideration).
pro: It's too expensive; furthermore, it's not very good.
insight: CEFR B2: Best word for adding points in an argument.

definition: As a consequence; for this reason.
pro: The traffic was heavy, hence the delay.
insight: CEFR C1: Very formal way to show results.

definition: By way of hypothesis; theoretically.
pro: Hypothetically, what would you do if you won the lottery?
insight: CEFR C1: Used for imaginary scenarios.

definition: Existing or occurring at the beginning.
pro: My initial reaction was one of complete surprise.
insight: CEFR B1: Better than 'first' for professional talk.

definition: In every case or on every occasion; always.
pro: He is invariably late for our morning meetings.
insight: CEFR C1: Use this instead of 'always' to sound advanced.

definition: In a way that conforms to circumstances or rules.
pro: I am legitimately concerned about the budget.
insight: CEFR B2: Use this to show you are serious.

definition: As a further matter; besides.
pro: He is a great athlete; moreover, he is a good student.
insight: CEFR B2: A formal way to add information.

definition: In spite of that; notwithstanding; all the same.
pro: It was very cold; nevertheless, we went for a run.
insight: CEFR B2: Excellent for building complex sentences.

definition: Mainly; for the most part.
pro: The city is predominantly inhabited by young people.
insight: CEFR C1: High-level way to say 'mostly'.

definition: At the same time.
pro: The movie will be released simultaneously in ten countries.
insight: CEFR B2: Used for multi-tasking and events.

definition: In a way that is exact and clear; precisely.
pro: I specifically asked for the report by Friday.
insight: CEFR B1: Use this to focus on one thing.

definition: Coming after something in time; following.
pro: The initial meeting was short, but subsequent ones were long.
insight: CEFR B2: A formal alternative to 'next'.

definition: In contrast or comparison with the fact that.
pro: I prefer tea, whereas my brother loves coffee.
insight: CEFR B2: The best word for direct contrast.

definition: Discuss a matter without coming to the point.
pro: Stop beating around the bush and tell me what you think.
insight: Native Usage: Common when someone is avoiding the truth.

definition: A situation where you can enjoy the advantages of two very different things.
pro: Living in the city but working near the beach is the best of both worlds.
insight: Native Usage: Used for ideal balance.

definition: It is better to do something late than not to do it at all.
pro: I finally finished the book; better late than never!
insight: Native Usage: A very common polite expression.

definition: Do or say something to relieve tension or get a conversation going.
pro: He told a joke to break the ice at the start of the meeting.
insight: Native Usage: Crucial for social situations.

definition: Decide or agree to stop doing something.
pro: We've been working for ten hours; let's call it a day.
insight: Native Usage: Standard for ending work/study sessions.

definition: Come to the point.
pro: I'm in a hurry, so let's cut to the chase.
insight: Native Usage: Used to save time.

definition: Go to bed.
pro: I'm exhausted, I'm going to hit the sack.
insight: Native Usage: Casual way to say you're sleeping.

definition: Remain cheerful in a difficult situation.
pro: Keep your chin up, things will get better soon.
insight: Native Usage: Used to encourage someone.

term: Let the cat out of the bag
definition: Reveal a secret carelessly or by mistake.
pro: Who let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party?
insight: Native Usage: Used for leaked secrets.

definition: Be too slow to take advantage of an opportunity.
pro: If you don't buy the tickets now, you'll miss the boat.
insight: Native Usage: Used for missed chances.

definition: You must work hard to achieve something.
pro: I'm sore after the gym, but no pain, no gain!
insight: Native Usage: Famous fitness/study phrase.

definition: Alert to new ideas, methods, and trends.
pro: You are really on the ball today; you finished everything early.
insight: Native Usage: A high compliment for efficiency.

definition: Very rarely.
pro: I only see my old school friends once in a blue moon.
insight: Native Usage: Standard for 'almost never'.

definition: Something easily achieved.
pro: That exam was a piece of cake!
insight: Native Usage: Used for any easy task.

definition: Deceive someone playfully; tease someone.
pro: Is it really raining? Or are you just pulling my leg?
insight: Native Usage: Used for friendly joking.

definition: Be in full agreement.
pro: We don't always see eye to eye on politics.
insight: Native Usage: Used for opinions.

definition: Under all circumstances, no matter how difficult.
pro: They have been friends through thick and thin.
insight: Native Usage: Describes strong loyalty.

definition: Slightly unwell or in low spirits.
pro: I won't be coming to work; I'm feeling a bit under the weather.
insight: Native Usage: The most common way to say you're slightly ill.

definition: Understand something complicated.
pro: I can't wrap my head around this new math problem.
insight: Native Usage: Used for difficult topics.

term: Your guess is as good as mine
definition: To have no idea about something.
pro: Where is he? Your guess is as good as mine!
insight: Native Usage: Used when you lack information.
